@jipanyang That still needs investigation. That issue was caused by teamd after swss, which still should work. But let's get teamd after syncd in to solve the timing issue first.

@jipanyang here is the RCA you asked for when I checked in patch 0009. I think patch 0006, 0008, 0009 and 0011 incrementally solved the issue and this should be the last piece of the puzzle.

I have not gone through code flow thoroughly.  Likely I missed some key points.

When adding member,  there is processing to fetch the member attribute via netlink synchronously (team_refresh() ?   All the member attribute info should be available at kernel at that time based on the upper layer dependency control.  

Why need to have dependency on RTM_NEWLINK event?  Would the previous patches be unnecessary but just adding some complexity,  if team_refresh() change here works?

I think they are fixing timing issue too. My previous 2 patches are fixing the timing issue with sequence of (1) create port, (2) RMT_NEWLINK but initial update failed. This last change was fixing the time sequence of (1) RTM_NEWLINK but initial update failed, (2) create port.

Have you checked this patch?
https://github.com/jpirko/libteam/commit/45912ded9cb5166d8286a6a4fb53bfe9fffcd8a9

@pavel-shirshov The change you identified has passed 200-ish iterations of tests where I removed patch 0006, 0007, 0008 and the patch in this PR. It looks like this change could be the fix. Thanks for looking into it!
This PR can be merged after https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/2842 is merged.
how much is reduced?

No clean cherry-pick. But should be a simple modification and I will submit a PR after this committed.

@lguohan: PR for master branch: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/2795
retest this please

When swss.service failed, snmp.service fails and restart of swss.service does not start snmp.service when using ```Requisite```.
However ```Requires``` has the same behaviour if swss and snmp failed to start.

@stepanblyschak: Can you clarify your last comment? Are you stating a problem here? A restart of swss.service *should* also restart snmp.service. This is the behavior we want, and it I believe this should happen with both `Requires` and `Requisite`. The behavior we *don't* want is for a call to start snmp.service to also attempt restarting swss.service if it is stopped -- `Requires` causes this to happen, whereas `Requisite` should not.

@jleveque 
"A restart of swss.service should also restart snmp.service" - this works as expected
"don't want is for a call to start snmp.service to also attempt restarting swss.service if it is stopped" - this works as expected

If swss.service is stopped/inactive and snmp.service is stopped/inactive restart of swss.service does not start snmp.service. Is this desired?
@jleveque Similar behaviour as described for dhcp_relay here: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/issues/2752
I see. OK. Then this behavior should be fine. Once I add in the changes I describe in the issue you linked, the latter behavior should also work.
can you add better description of the pr and also a clear title?
swss docker is the same for all platforms, instead of using template, let's move it out of platform folder.
@lguohan please review

@andriymoroz-mlnx do we still want to merge this change after https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/2788 being merged to 201803?

This is just a question, not a rejection :-)

yes, because if after upgrade reboot will be via power/kernel crash/etc or user will not change default in GRUB but select it manually on boot we need this fix to let post-boot FW burn finish successfully

Just to summarize.
In all recent active branches (including 201803) the FW burn is done before the reboot command (any reboot type which is supported). But in rare cases when FW is to be burn after power off/hard reset we should make sure syncd will not be restarted in the middle of that.

@renukamanavalan: Please format description using markdown (enclose code/output blocks in triple-backticks (```))
Can you please post the results and as well the command to run the tests?

@renukamanavalan 

For fan speed control validation test, thermal test ambient range from 20C–45C–20C to complete 1 cycle, 5C each step, waiting the temperature reach stable state and change to next step, record all fan speed data from `sensors` command in the duration. 

**Result**: Fan speed curve based on FSC algorithm (F2B)

![F2B](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/LCCJJLgq2sgp2MYA4Z3FvkwGZDvz0M4H2ke-Xy1i7BZ9LmRrxq-o7V6tcjX6dCuyE-ett4Gfz00kLOMlsRMt7osrsU1JsI4ZZBsCiaJn_XC2m3g8MCEzWYHQ52lzWFp3kx_hidaJPg=w525-h266-no?.jpg)

**Result**: Fan speed curve based on FSC algorithm (B2F)

![B2F](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/UVBC3mlPWH_UtTI1N3g_faZZEDMsXs_i3pl8hiTHL6DSsRxOxOfcEjMOW508ymulKdabCB7pF1cVvNi4LaM3n8mJ5gbsf3BHA-Tg0V3_WOvtHrWCSopKhQZcQWWPfvzACFapitaByA=w522-h263-no?.jpg)

**Conclution**: The actual fan speed curve match fan speed control algorithm setting and all components temperature is under the required operating conditions.

Is there a automated way to test this script ?

Reason: We would like to test this locally, when we get the updated image

@renukamanavalan , In this version we didn't prepare the way for automate test, 
We just record fan speed during thermal change on test chamber.
why baseimage build failed? can you investigate?
retest this please
@hzheng5, any update on this PR?

> @hzheng5, any update on this PR?

Hi @lguohan 

I did some investigation. Looks like the base build is using "BLDENV=stretch make -f Makefile.work stretch" to compile all stretch targets. Our teamd docker is dependent on  swss, which is dependent on libsairedis and libsai.

For generic platform, we don't build any libsai on stretch, so we are hitting the following error.

/sonic/src/sonic-sairedis/meta/.libs/libsaimetadata.so /sonic/src/sonic-sairedis/meta/.libs/libsaimeta.so -ldl
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lsai
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
Makefile:650: recipe for target 'syncd' failed
make[4]: *** [syncd] Error 1
make[4]: Leaving directory '/sonic/src/sonic-sairedis/syncd'

Is there a way to include any libsai to generic platform ? Or to block teamd build in baseimage.

Thanks,
Haiyang

> @hzheng5, any update on this PR?

Another question is SWSS has also been upgraded to stretch, why "BLDENV=stretch make -f Makefile.work stretch"  didn't trigger the swss docker build, it may hit the same issue here.

Did I miss anything that excludes swss docker from the stretch target?

Thanks,
Haiyang
#2771 might solve this issue.

> #2771 might solve this issue.

Cool. Thanks. Let me give a try locally first.

Reverted in 201811 branch due to reported bug.
Revert will start from master branch instead of limited to 201811 branch.

The change looks good to me, but I'm not sure whether it could guarantee this: "teamd requires netdevs created by syncd".   Having syncd started before teamd doesn't mean all netdev would be ready when teamd nees them.
No, the change doesn't guarantee netdev being created. I just want to state all the dependencies I know.

> The change looks good to me, but I'm not sure whether it could guarantee this: "teamd requires netdevs created by syncd". Having syncd started before teamd doesn't mean all netdev would be ready when teamd nees them.

Ok,  putting the statement here make people think that the change also addresses that issue.

how is this related this PR?

https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/2626
@lguohan this change is intended to replace #2626
I feel that we need to drill down the root cause of that device name missing issue.  Patching with all the workaround doesn't seem to be a long term solution.

@jipanyang I agree with you. That might take longer time. If we identify the root cause and proper fix. I don't mind revert this change and #2699.

Frankly speaking, I thought about this. I think the other way to fix the issue is to delay creating LAG devices after warm reboot. But I don't know a good indication of 'readiness' to do so.

I suggest revisit the warm-reboot flag design, the complexity become so unnecessary consider the simple requirements. Instead of collaboratively edit DB, we could use a single service or library. The warm-reboot is top-down imperative in concept.
#2725 is created to get this change in 201811 since this PR might be blocked for a while due to unable to move utilities submodule head.
retest this please
retest this please
what is the dependent PR for this PR?

> what is the dependent PR for this PR?

I think the PR(https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/807) is dependent on this PR. Because vxlanmgrd cannot automatically start if this PR isn't merged, which will make the PR(https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/807) cannot pass the testing. 
Because we change the table name from cfg* to app* in swss Orch, so that the app db will lose the information of vnet and vxlan_tunnel without the vxlanmgrd.

OK, Updated

I don't think all SAI comes with dbg packet available. These SAI open sourced and built with sonic-buildimage will more likely have access to the dbg packet. But not others, e.g. Broadcom SAI doesn't have dbg packet available. You might want to remove this feature from these flavors of SAI.

@yxieca This change does not install dbg packages for SAI vendor implementation;
libsairedis-dbg and libsaimetadata-dbg come from sairedis sources

code is still buggy.

Joe, I agree with the standards, but in S6000 we are using polling method so we used a 1 second delay in while loop if no change in transceiver status. Instead, if an OIR change is detected we return updated port_dict to xcvrd. So, the core need for timeout variable is achieved without using that in the code. The code block indefinitely until an OIR change is detected without timeout variable.  I modified the function definition as per the API standard.

Joe, added timeout support in xcvrd. Here we used time.time() library which is which is subject to variance as per system clock adjustments. This helps us to detect modified time variations.  We handle timeout value and update port_dict within the given timeout value. Only incremental updates are sent to xcvrd. We sleep if there is no change with 1 second granularity..
